Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Arrhythmia Management in Tetralogy of Fallot

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the individual patient. Sample size calculation was based on detecting a clinically significant difference in arrhythmia control.

Participants.evidence: Participants included ToF patients across various age groups with documented arrhythmias.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either pharmacologic therapy or interventional therapy.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate the effectiveness of different arrhythmia management strategies in ToF patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was arrhythmia control over a 12-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the pharmacologic group and 100 to the interventional group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 98 participants in the pharmacologic group and 97 in the interventional group using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The interventional group showed a significant improvement in arrhythmia control (mean difference = 5.2, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 3% of the pharmacologic group and 1% of the interventional group.

Funding.evidence: This trial was funded by the National Institutes of Health.
